H0.text: Increase size and number of cells is how multicellular organisms grow in size.

H1.text: Reducing size and number of cells is how multicellular organisms grow in size.

H2.text: Increasing the number of limbs is how multicellular organisms grow in size.

H3.text: Increasing size and number of genes is how multicellular organisms grow in size.

A4.text: Multicellularity allows organisms to exceed size limits normally imposed by diffusion, providing a competitive advantage.

A5.text: Multicellular organisms arise in various ways, for example by cell division or by aggregation of many single cells.
